description: From Yiddish שיכּור‎ (shiker, “drunk”), from Hebrew שיכּור‎.

adjectives.description: shickered (comparative more shickered, superlative most shickered)

examples: ‘I'm shikkered. I've never been so shikkered before. Do you know how I know? Because,’ he started giggling, ‘because I don't normally fucking swear.’

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of shicker
